WorkItem.Description:
Please see the picture, my original gears were about ilvl 200. Then I selected some badge items, and optimized. This is the list I got.
With the better (I suppose) gears, my dps is lower?

Comments.Message: Seems like some unexpected items were selected when optimized. Why the tempered helm could be better than spiked helm?
You didn't mark many of the items and enchants that you had before as available.
Had this happen quite often to my shadow and holy priest(s), just never bothered to report it.  When this occurs, at least one item (currently geared item) is always selected via the green diamond.

No, really. If the Optimizer ever gives a result that's lower than your current score, that really does mean that you didn't mark all of your current gear available. You can quickly do so on the Current Gear chart. Or if it ever leaves a slot (item or enchant) empty, that means you didn't mark an item/enchant available for that slot.

Not necessarily.  If I ever go for a low thoroughness (roughly 40%), I've noticed that I sometimes end up with a lower score than my current score.  This may be due to the high number of gemming templates I use combined with the very low thoroughness setting.  I can attempt to reproduce this, if you like.  What's surprising is that I assume there is a check to ensure that the value of the new set is â‰¥ the value of the current set.

In the vast, overwhelming majority of cases, however, the issue is not marking something as available to the optimizer - be it gems, enchants, or gear.
I'm 90% certain that there is a check for new >= old, but that check is ignored if the old wasn't fully available.
Or there's a bug in a specific model that you're trying to optimize against.  Something I found in the TankDK model while deploying the Dual-Wielding code.

I've seen this a number of times, Astry.  I've optimized and gotten 5001.4 DPS.  Optimize again, get 4996.2dps.  Optimize a third time, get 5001.4dps.  No changes are made between optimizes.

This is when I have "too many gems" -- I have two templates for epic gems (all arp, and one of r:arp, y:str/crit, b:arp/sta).  Then I have separate stand-alone gems for JC Arp, JC/epic Expertise, JC/epic Hit Rating, the +10stats and +6stats gems (+6 stats occasionally is an upgrade over my 10arp/15sta blue gem; +10stats always is).

As for the original report, though, it's quite clear what happened.  All the items were checked (or at least there were items checked for each slot).  None of the enchants were checked except for a shoulder enchant.
